catalog_info.title: The History of Hunger
catalog_info.description: Why did a Jamestown colonist butcher and eat his pregnant wife? Why were Gandhi’s hunger strikes so politically effective? This seminar will examine hunger in United States and global history from the early modern era to the present, considering topics including hunger strikes, famine, eating disorders, and the scientific study of hunger. Exploring hunger from a variety of angles, including food history, the environment, policy, empire, gender, and ethics, this course will analyze the impact that hunger has had on history, as well as changing ideas about hunger over time.
